divs: sighting details (note: my location is in historic downtown of cheyenne) i stepped outside in the backyard to smoke a cigarette and noticed the starry night we have tonight, with light clouds rolling through occasionally. as i observed the sky above, (my body was facing towards the east)i took notice to this object that appeared to be gliding across at a somewhat high rate of speed.(sort of how satellites appear when moving at a low but rapid speed.) at first i thought it was a satellite just very low in the sky, but then i noticed that the color of it was due to the reflection of the city lights which i then realised was way lower than a satellite should be. it was dim but had a reddish\amberish glow(the same sort of color\glow you see on clouds when they're generally passing over a city that contrasts a lot of light.) it almost appeared as if it were gliding across the sky heading towards the south-west. as it moved further away, the reddish\amberish glow of the object became more dim which i assume is from it moving away from the city and as it kept gliding along, the dim faded out completely and i lost site of it. the object appeared to be moving at a set speed, faster than an airplane or helicopter, therefore i couldn't "identify" what it was, also as it moved along in a sw direction, it seemed to start heading in more of a western direction before the dim glow of it faded out. after that, i looked around the sky to see if i could spot any other odd things but decided to head back inside after spending another 5 or 10 minutes obvserving. it was very odd and sort of caught me off guard especially being outside with no lights on and put me in an eery mood. it seems i always spot these weird occurences around this time of year and of course i am never close to a camera or video camera to catch it! if anybody in cheyenne or wyoming has spotted anything strange in the sky, report it! we want to hear about it!
trends: There have been 17 other sightings in Cheyenne
There were no other sightings in Cheyenne on or around August 2nd 2011
